title: DNA Extraction from Modern Dental Calculus

authors.name: Franziska Aron
authors.affiliation: Max Planck Institute for the Science of Human History

protocol.title: DNA Extraction from Modern Dental Calculus
protocol.title_html: DNA Extraction from Modern Dental Calculus

source.description:

to
of the calculus and transfer it into a 2ml-Eppendorf Safe-Lock DNA LoBind-Tube (use special accuracy scales)
Crush the calculus with a sterile metal pestle within the tube.

Add
EDTA and
Proteinase K (
)

Let it rotate in the dark at
for
(optional: over the weekend) until the calculus fully decalcifies and either disappears or becomes buoyant (floating and feathery in appearance)
Remove the tubes from the rotator and briefly centrifuge the extraction tubes

source.body: This centrifugation step is just made to remove the liquid from the lid.

source.description:
Transfer everything with a
pipette tip (supernatant and pellet) to the Power Bead tubes
Invert to mix.

Add
C1 solution, invert several times to mix.
Secure tubes horizontally on a flat-bed vortex pad with tape, vortex at maximum speed for

Centrifuge at
for
at

source.body: Make sure the Power Bead tubes can rotate without rubbing, 10.000 x g is the maximum, otherwise the tubes may break

source.description: Transfer supernatant to the 2ml collection tube (provided in the kit)

source.description: Bind the DNA on the membrane of spin filter unit:

Load

source.body: Note this step is optional, however it can be useful to remove exogenous fluids such as blood.

source.description:
Clean the metal pestle after every sample by incubating for
in a household bleach dilution , then wiping clean with HPLC-water and drying with a clean paper towel

source.body: Sterile plastic pestles can be used instead of metal pestles, but they must be changed between each sample and not re-used.

source.description:
Save power bead tubes at
as backup. These can be thrown out once you know the extraction worked
Store remaining supernatant at

source.body: We save this as backup until confirmation that the extraction worked. If extraction was successful, this can be discarded.

Place a 1.5ml/2ml tube rack at
for the incubation steps on the final days
Prepare a 1:10 dilution of household bleach solution (~6% hypochlorite) in a 50ml-Falcon tube

Label for each sample one 2ml-Eppendorf Safe-Lock DNA LoBind-Tube
and one 1.5ml-Eppendorf Safe-Lock DNA LoBind-Tube

Retrieve the spin filter columns (provided in the kit) from fridge to warm them up to
for use at step 26

source.body:
"provided in the kit" refers to: DNeasy PowerSoil Kit (100) Cat No./ID: 12888-100
A spin filter column is a spin filter unit sitting in a collection column. The spin filter unit contains the membrane.

source.description: Label for each sample one Power Bead tube, one spin filter column and three 2ml collection tubes (all provided in the kit)

materials.name: Centrifuge 5424 R refrigerated with Rotor FA-45-24-11 rotary knobs 120 V/50 – 60 Hz (US)

description: Protocol for DNA extraction from modern dental calculus samples for Illumina sequencing. This protocol uses the Qiagen PowerSoil DNA extraction kit.
